FuncDef:
The qos queue-resource pool command specifies a QoS resource pool for an interface.
The undo qos queue-resource pool command cancels the configuration.
By default, the ID of the resource pool for upstream traffic is 0, and the ID of the resource pool for downstream traffic is 1.
CLIs: undo qos queue-resource pool <id> { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of a QoS resource pool.
The value is 0 or 1.

Specifies the inbound direction of an interface.
-

Specifies the outbound direction of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable upstream or downstream to fully use QoS resources, run the qos queue-resource pool command to enable an interface to specify different QoS resource pools for traffic.
SQ resources on a single interface are not infinite and maybe insufficient on some interfaces. To enable incoming or outgoing traffic to fully use QoS resources, run the qos queue-resource pool command to allow the incoming or outgoing traffic on different interfaces to share an SQ resource pool.
Prerequisites
Run the command qos scheduling-mode mode2 to set the mode2 to be the scheduling mode before the command qos queue-resource pool is configured.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The interface including its sub-interfaces is not allowed to house online users.
This command is only supported on the LPUI-21-L/LPUI-51-L/LPUF-51/LPUF-51-B/LPUI-51/LPUI-51-B/LPUI-51-S/LPUS-51/LPUF-101/LPUF-101-B/LPUI-101/LPUI-101-B/LPUS-101/LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L boards.
